meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Estonia, equal to one hundredth of an Estonian kroon.
meanings.sent1: I bought a candy bar for ten kune.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper accepted payment in kune.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel saved up kune to buy nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of kune.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kune coins jingled in his pocket.

meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Papua New Guinea, equal to one hundredth of a Papua New Guinean kina.
meanings.sent1: She exchanged her kune for local currency.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor priced the fruit in kune.
meanings.sent3: The parrot collected colorful kune for its nest.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as a bag of kune.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter was like a handful of kune.

meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Croatia, equal to one hundredth of a Croatian dinar.
meanings.sent1: The souvenir shop displayed items priced in kune.
meanings.sent2: The traveler exchanged euros for kune at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the jar of kune, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were worth more than a sack of kune.
meanings.sent5: The sun glinted off the shiny kune coins.
